page.title: 06Typical farm,north Upottery.
page.content: On this small farm with a dairy herd of 60, no crop other than grass is grown and the farmer swears by a 2:1:1 type of fertiliser,convinced that a higher amount of nitrogen gives nothing but a temporary boost. He makes all his own hay and silage,using his own machinery. His baler produces the older square type of bale.,and he uses no blower for drying his hay. In principle, he is against the destruction of hedges,since they provide shelter for the cattle and a home for wild-life,but confesses to having removed one or two,where he had very small fields indeed. According to him,6 acres is the absolute minimum size for working his machinery. This is a farmer of the old type,who drove a tractor from the age of 7 and escaped from academic instruction,with relief,as soon as he could!
